summary: This document is email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorneys and other parties regarding the technical loading of subpoenaed documents from the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner into the Relativity e-discovery platform for the case USA v. Epstein (2018R01618). It discusses folder structures and the exclusion of DVD video files from the upload.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender/recipient of emails coordinating the upload of subpoenaed documents from Boies Schiller Flexner into the Relativity system for the Epstein case.

events.title: Boies Schiller first subpoena response
events.description: The law firm Boies Schiller Flexner produces documents in response to a subpoena from the Southern District of New York in the Epstein case.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Boies Schiller second subpoena response
events.description: A second production of documents by the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner in response to a subpoena.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The document references the criminal case USA v. Epstein (docket number 2018R01618) in the Southern District of New York.
The law firm Boies Schiller Flexner (BSF) was served with subpoenas and produced documents on at least two dates: March 4, 2019, and April 18, 2019.
Prosecutors were actively managing the ingestion of these subpoena returns into the Relativity e-discovery platform, indicating an ongoing investigation.
The subpoena returns included video files (DVD format) from interviews, which were to be excluded from the Relativity upload due to technical format issues.
The correspondence shows detailed coordination between legal and technical staff regarding the organization of evidence for the case.
